qas.question: When was the golden age of Catalan?
Where was the center of the Crown of Aragon?
What was the official language of Sicily until the 15th century?
Until what century was Catalan used as the official language in Sardinia?
Who called Catalan one of the great languages?

context: In the <a0_0>Low Middle Ages<a0_0/>, <a2_0>Catalan<a2_0/> went through a golden age, reaching a peak of maturity and cultural richness. Examples include the work of Majorcan polymath Ramon Llull (1232–1315), the Four Great Chronicles (13th–14th centuries), and the Valencian school of poetry culminating in Ausiàs March (1397–1459). By the 15th century, the <a1_0>city of Valencia<a1_0/> had become the sociocultural center of the Crown of Aragon, and Catalan was present all over the Mediterranean world. During this period, the Royal Chancery propagated a highly standardized language. Catalan was widely used as an official language in Sicily until the 15th century, and in Sardinia until the <a3_0>17th<a3_0/>. During this period, the language was what <a4_0>Costa Carreras<a4_0/> terms "one of the 'great languages' of medieval Europe".
